moves.1. e4 e5: We both open up our queen and kingside bishops
moves.2. d4: Now I open up my other bishop
moves.5... f6: ...but my opponent puts up some defence...
moves.6... Bc5 7. Qg3: ..and again, guarding the f2 square, and lining an assault on the far right-hand corner.
moves.8... Qe7 9. Qxh8: ...and I take it, instead of the queen.
moves.10. Be3: ...so it's time to put up some defence.
moves.14. Bc4: ...so I unleash my remaining bishop in an attempt to free my caged queen...
moves.14... Nc2 15. Qxg8+: ...which I do, with a bit of luck...
moves.16... Nxa3 17. bxa3: Now, with the knight out of the way...
moves.17... Rb8: ...my opponent launches an assault on the b-file...
moves.18. Bxh7: ...so I cover the bottom rank b1 square by removing another pawn...
moves.19. Bxb1: ...as I had that square covered. Crazy game or what?
